docs.text:

docs.title: What Makes Rocket Different?Ready to Transform Learning?
docs.text:
Rocket goes beyond traditional point systems by integrating real-world rewards, behavioral science, and seamless LMS integration to create lasting engagement that drives measurable learning outcomes.

3,000+ Brand partners across 35+ countries 94% Training completion rate improvement 34% Increase in course completion 24/7 Dedicated support team

Success Story

"Rocket increased our course completion rates by 34% and student engagement scores by 28% within the first semester. The real-world rewards created genuine motivation for learning."

— Dr. Sarah Mitchell, Academic Technology Director

Start building engaging educational experiences with Rocket's powerful gamification platform. Join leading educational institutions already using Rocket to drive better outcomes.

Get Started Contact Sales

docs.title: 🤖 AI-Powered Engagement Insights
docs.text: Rocket uses machine learning to uncover patterns in learner behaviour, optimise reward strategies, and predict dropout risk or engagement dips before they happen.

docs.title: 1. What Rocket Tracks
docs.text:
Rocket collects metadata from learning systems via:

  • Event timestamps
  • Activity types
  • Sequence patterns
  • Engagement frequency and depth

No content data or PII is used for training models.

docs.title: 2. Predictive Models Used
docs.text:
Rocket applies the following models:

Model Type Purpose Classification Predicts likelihood of dropout or disengagement Clustering Segments learners by engagement pattern Regression Forecasts optimal reward intervals

docs.title: 3. Intelligent Reward Suggestions
docs.text:
Rocket's engine analyses individual and group behaviours to:

  • Suggest new high-impact behaviours to incentivise
  • Detect and reduce reward abuse (e.g. spam posts, gaming completions)
  • Adapt reward values based on effort rarity or consistency

docs.title: 4. Visual Dashboards
docs.text:
Admins and instructors receive:

  • Weekly engagement heatmaps
  • Risk cohort alerts (e.g. “Low activity over 5 days”)
  • Comparative success rates across different reward rules

docs.title: 5. Institutional Configuration
docs.text:
AI insights are entirely opt-in and can be configured at the institution level:

```yaml ai_insights: enabled: true exclude_behaviours: [forum_post_viewed] report_frequency: weekly send_to: [admin@example.edu]

docs.title: 🎁 Points & Rewards System (Technical Overview)
docs.text: Rocket translates learning effort into tangible incentives through a modular and secure points engine. This page details how point attribution, management, and redemption are handled.

docs.title: 1. Points Engine
docs.text:
Each learner action is evaluated against a ruleset defined by the institution. Rules include:

  • Event name and conditions
  • Point value
  • Frequency limits
  • Cooldowns or reset intervals

Points are granted only when all rule conditions are satisfied.

docs.title: 2. Points Ledger Architecture
docs.text:
Rocket maintains a real-time, write-once ledger for all point transactions. Each entry includes:

  • User ID
  • Action performed
  • Points awarded
  • Rule ID
  • Timestamp
  • Source system (e.g., LMS name)

This enables full traceability and export to BI tools.

docs.title: 3. Reward Tiers and Categories
docs.text:
Institutions can define reward tiers:

Tier Name Points Required Example Rewards Starter 50 £5 gift card, app badge Committed 200 £20 voucher, early access Influencer 500 Large discount, premium perks

Categories can be filtered by brand type (tech, food, retail), engagement type, or budget.

docs.title: 4. Redemption Controls
docs.text:
Redemption workflows include:

  • Verification of points balance
  • Rule-based availability (e.g., badge gated rewards)
  • Institution-funded vs. self-funded separation
  • Token or voucher generation via secure partner API

docs.title: 5. Funding Model Support
docs.text:
Rocket supports:

  • Institution-funded rewards (via monthly budgets)
  • Learner-purchased rewards (discounts for effort)
  • Hybrid models (e.g., earn tokens → get discounts)

docs.title: 6. Abuse Prevention & Anti-Gaming
docs.text:
Built-in controls include:

  • Reward cooldowns
  • Rate limiting (per day/week/month)
  • Rule chaining to detect hollow activity
  • AI-powered fraud pattern detection (e.g., rapid post/delete loops)

docs.title: 7. Export & Reporting
docs.text:
Points data can be exported via:

  • CSV (manual or scheduled)
  • API endpoints (/api/user/points)
  • Integration with Power BI, Mixpanel, or other analytics tools

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Welcome to Rocket Learning Rewards! This guide will help you set up your gamification system quickly and efficiently.

docs.title: Quick Setup Overview
docs.text:
Rocket can be set up and ready to drive engagement in your learning environment in just a few steps:

  1. Requirements - Check system requirements and prerequisites
  2. First Steps - Initial configuration and setup
  3. Go Live - Launch your rewards program

docs.title: What You'll Need
docs.text:
• Access to your LMS administrator account
  • Student/learner data for import
  • Reward catalog preferences for your organization

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Choose your path to get started:

  • New to Rocket? Start with How It Works
  • Ready to implement? Jump to First Steps
  • Need to check compatibility? Review Requirements

For questions or support during setup, visit our Support Center or contact our team directly.

docs.title: Create Your First Reward Campaign
docs.text: Once your system is set up, creating your first reward campaign is straightforward. This guide walks you through setting up a basic campaign to reward course completion.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before creating your first campaign, ensure:

✅ Pre-Campaign Checklist LMS integration is active and tested Student accounts have been imported Reward catalogue is configured Point allocation strategy is defined Budget and spending limits are set

docs.title: Step 1: Access the Campaign Manager
docs.text:
1. Log in as Administrator in your LMS
  2. Navigate to Rocket Rewards → Campaign Manager
  3. Click "Create New Campaign"

docs.title: Step 2: Configure Basic Settings
docs.text:
1 Campaign Details

Fill out the basic campaign information:

  • Name: "Welcome Campaign" or "Course Completion Rewards"
  • Description: Brief explanation of the campaign purpose
  • Start Date: When the campaign should begin
  • End Date: Campaign expiration (optional)
2 Trigger Conditions

Define what actions will trigger rewards:

  • Event Type: Course completion
  • Conditions: Minimum grade or completion percentage
  • Frequency: Once per course per student
3 Reward Configuration

Set up the reward details:

  • Points Value: 100 points (suggested starting value)
  • Bonus Conditions: Extra points for high grades
  • Limits: Maximum points per student per campaign

docs.title: Step 3: Review and Activate
docs.text:
⚠️ Important

Review all settings carefully before activation. Some changes may not be possible after the campaign goes live.

Final Review Checklist: - [ ] Campaign name and description are clear - [ ] Trigger conditions match your learning objectives - [ ] Point values align with your overall strategy - [ ] Budget impact is within acceptable limits - [ ] Start/end dates are correct

Activate Campaign: 1. Click "Review Campaign" to see a summary 2. If everything looks correct, click "Save & Activate" 3. The campaign will become active immediately

Your first campaign is now live! Students will start earning points as soon as they complete the specified activities. 🎉 Campaign Activated

Monitor progress through your analytics dashboard

docs.title: Real-Time Analytics
docs.text:
Once your campaign is active, monitor its performance through:

  • Student Participation: How many students are engaging
  • Point Distribution: Total points awarded and patterns
  • Activity Correlation: Which activities drive the most engagement
  • Budget Utilisation: Spending against allocated budget

docs.title: Common First Campaign Metrics
docs.text:
0 Students Participating 0 Points Awarded 0 Rewards Redeemed 0% Budget Used

Note: These metrics will populate with real data once your campaign is active.

docs.title: Week 1: Observe and Monitor
docs.text:
• Watch for initial student engagement
  • Check that points are being awarded correctly
  • Monitor any technical issues or confusion

docs.title: Week 2: Gather Feedback
docs.text:
• Survey participating students about their experience
  • Get feedback from instructors on any observed changes
  • Identify any needed adjustments

docs.title: Week 3: Optimise
docs.text:
• Adjust point values if needed
  • Add additional trigger conditions
  • Expand successful elements to other courses

docs.title: Week 4: Scale
docs.text:
• Create additional campaigns for different activities
  • Increase budget allocation if ROI is positive
  • Plan advanced features and integrations

Need Help? - Campaign Configuration Guide - Detailed setup instructions - Analytics Dashboard - Understanding your metrics - Support - Get assistance from our team

docs.title: Getting Started with Rocket
docs.text: Rocket is an educational rewards system designed to incentivise positive Learner engagement in learning management systems (LMS). The platform provides points-based rewards for academic activities and allows Learner to redeem points for real-world rewards and discounts.

docs.title: Target Users
docs.text:
• Learners: Primary users earning and redeeming points
  • Learning Managers: Monitor Learner engagement and progress

docs.title: What You'll Learn
docs.text:
• Platform Overview

    Understand Rocket's core concepts and how it enhances student engagement.

    Learn the Basics

  • Installation

    Step-by-step guide to set up Rocket in your environment.

    Installation Guide

  • First Integration

    Connect your LMS and configure your first reward system.

    Quick Setup

  • Configuration

    Customize Rocket to match your institution's needs.

    Basic Configuration

docs.title: Core Concepts
docs.text: Before diving into implementation, let's understand Rocket's fundamental concepts:

docs.title: The Rocket Ecosystem
docs.text:
flowchart LR
    A[Learning Activities] --> B[Points System]
    B --> C[Streak Tracking]
    C --> D[Rank Progression]
    D --> E[Rewards & Benefits]
    E --> F[Student Engagement]
    F --> A

docs.title: Key Components
docs.text:
Points SystemStreak SystemRank SystemReward System

Students earn points for various learning activities:

  • Course Module Views: 25 points
  • Discussion Posts: 50 points
  • Quiz Completions: 100 points
  • Assignment Submissions: 150 points
  • Survey Completions: 100 points

Consecutive weeks of achieving weekly point goals:

  • Encourages consistent engagement
  • Unlocks rank progression
  • Provides bonus rewards
  • Builds learning habits

Three progressive tiers with increasing benefits:

Rank Requirement Benefits Explorer 0-3 weeks Basic discounts Pilot 4-6 weeks Enhanced rewards Commander 7+ weeks Premium benefits

Real-world incentives through Tillo integration:

  • Gift cards from major brands
  • Percentage discounts
  • Rocket Launch lottery entries
  • Exclusive commander benefits

docs.title: Student Journey
docs.text:
journey
    title Student Experience with Rocket
    section Onboarding
      Complete Orientation: 5: Student
      Set Goals: 4: Student
      Learn System: 3: Student
    section Weekly Cycle
      Complete Activities: 5: Student
      Earn Points: 5: Student
      Maintain Streak: 4: Student
    section Rewards
      Browse Rewards: 4: Student
      Redeem Points: 5: Student
      Play Rocket Launch: 5: Student
    section Progression
      Advance Rank: 5: Student
      Unlock Benefits: 5: Student
      Access New Rewards: 5: Student

docs.title: Administrator Workflow
docs.text:
1. Setup: Configure organisation settings and user management
  2. Integration: Connect LMS and configure event triggers
  3. Customisation: Set point values, rewards, and limits
  4. Monitoring: Track engagement and financial metrics
  5. Optimisation: Adjust settings based on analytics

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before implementing Rocket, ensure you have:

Technical Requirements

  • LMS: Moodle, OpenLMS, or LearnWorlds instance
  • AWS Account: For hosting and infrastructure
  • Tillo Account: For reward fulfillment
  • Domain: For custom branding
  • Email Service: For notifications

Access Requirements

  • Administrator access to your LMS
  • Ability to install plugins (for Moodle/OpenLMS)
  • API access credentials
  • Financial approval for reward budgets

docs.text:

  2. Quick Start: Configure your first integration
  3. Configuration: Customise for your institution
  4. Testing: Validate your implementation

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text: Before implementing Rocket Learning Rewards, ensure your environment meets these requirements for optimal performance.

docs.title: Supported Platforms
docs.text:
Rocket integrates with 15+ learning management systems:

  • Moodle (3.0+)
  • Canvas (2018+)
  • Blackboard (9.1+)
  • LearnWorlds (All versions)
  • Schoology (2019+)
  • Brightspace/D2L (10.5+)
  • Google Classroom (All versions)
  • Microsoft Teams for Education (2020+)

View complete integration guide →

docs.title: Minimum System Requirements
docs.text:
• Internet Connection: Stable broadband (10+ Mbps recommended)
  • Browser Support: Chrome 90+, Firefox 88+, Safari 14+, Edge 90+
  • Storage: 1GB available space for data sync
  • Memory: 4GB RAM minimum, 8GB recommended

docs.title: Administrator Access Required
docs.text:
• LMS administrator permissions
  • Ability to install LMS plugins/add-ons (if applicable)
  • Access to student/user data for CSV export
  • SMTP settings for email notifications (optional)

docs.title: Student Information
docs.text:
For successful implementation, you'll need:

  • Student roster with unique IDs
  • Email addresses (for reward delivery)
  • Course enrollment data
  • Grade/progress tracking data

docs.title: File Formats
docs.text:
• CSV imports: UTF-8 encoded, specific column headers
  • Grade sync: Standard gradebook export formats
  • User data: Compatible with LMS user export formats

Download CSV template →

docs.title: Data Protection
docs.text:
• GDPR Compliant: Full data protection compliance
  • FERPA Compliant: Educational privacy standards
  • SOC 2 Type II: Security framework certification
  • SSL/TLS: End-to-end encryption for all data

docs.title: Privacy Requirements
docs.text:
• Student consent for reward delivery (where required)
  • Data retention policy agreement
  • Regional compliance verification

docs.title: Firewall Settings
docs.text:
Ensure these domains are whitelisted:

  • *.rocketeducationrewards.com
  • api.rocket-rewards.com
  • cdn.rocket-assets.com

docs.title: Port Requirements
docs.text:
• HTTPS: Port 443 (outbound)
  • API Calls: Standard HTTPS traffic
  • Webhooks: Port 443 (inbound, optional)

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
Having trouble with requirements? Our team can help:

  • Technical Assessment: Free compatibility check
  • Implementation Support: Dedicated onboarding specialist
  • Custom Integration: Enterprise-level customization

Contact Support → | Schedule Assessment

Next Step: Once requirements are confirmed, proceed to First Steps for initial setup.

docs.title: Installation & Setup
docs.text: This guide covers the technical installation and initial configuration of Rocket Learning Rewards for your institution.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before beginning installation, ensure you have:

🔧 Technical Prerequisites LMS (Moodle 3.8+ or LearnWorlds) with admin access Node.js 14+ installed on your server API credentials for your LMS platform Domain access for DNS configuration AWS account credentials (provided by Rocket team)

docs.title: Step 1: Repository Setup
docs.text:
Clone the Rocket Rewards repository to your server:

# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/rocket-education/rocket-rewards.git
cd rocket-rewards

# Install dependencies
npm install

# Verify installation
npm run verify
💡 Pro Tip

Use a bot user token for API access. This helps you track events separately from human users and provides better security isolation.

docs.title: Step 2: Environment Configuration
docs.text:
Configure your environment variables by creating a .env file:

```yaml

docs.title: LMS Configuration
docs.text: LMS_URL=https://yourlms.example.com LMS_TYPE=moodle # or 'canvas', 'learnworlds' API_TOKEN=your_api_token_here

docs.title: Database Configuration
docs.text: DATABASE_URL=postgresql://user:password@localhost:5432/rocket_rewards REDIS_URL=redis://localhost:6379

docs.title: Rocket Configuration
docs.text: ROCKET_API_KEY=provided_by_rocket_team ROCKET_ENVIRONMENT=production # or 'staging', 'development'

docs.title: Security
docs.text: JWT_SECRET
